Hasdrubal was in command on the left wing, and Livy has not explicitly stated anything about him since the Roman cavalry was routed. Polybius says that he galloped to support the Numidians on the right, and sent them to pursue the allied cavalry, who gave way at his approach, while he himself charged the Romans in the centre. Livy has omitted some details, or they have dropped out of his text. .
